body_html: @HedgehogCode This works for NFS in Windows. Make sure you have group policy enabled or just download gpedit.msc. Check if Enable Long File Path is indeed enabled in LocalGroupPolicyFolder > Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > System > Filesystem > NTFS. Then restart your system. Go to Windows terminal and test it out.
body_text: @HedgehogCode This works for NFS in Windows. Make sure you have group policy enabled or just download gpedit.msc. Check if Enable Long File Path is indeed enabled in LocalGroupPolicyFolder > Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > System > Filesystem > NTFS. Then restart your system. Go to Windows terminal and test it out.
body: @HedgehogCode This works for NFS in Windows. Make sure you have group policy enabled or just download `gpedit.msc`. Check if `Enable Long File Path` is indeed enabled in `LocalGroupPolicyFolder > Computer Configuration > Administrative Templates > System > Filesystem > NTFS`. Then restart your system. Go to Windows terminal and test it out.
